intro: Hedyosmum tepuiense, commonly known as the tepui mountain hedyosmum, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Hedyosmum tepuiense is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique adaptations to its mountainous habitat.
